intro: Tibouchina aemula, commonly known as the purple tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its vibrant purple to pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that have a slightly hairy texture. Tibouchina aemula thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
